Permitted Refinancing: means, with respect to any Person, any modification, refinancing, refunding,   renewal, replacement, exchange or extension of any Indebtedness of such Person; provided that (a) the principal   amount (or accreted value, if applicable) thereof does not exceed the principal amount (or accreted value, if   applicable) of the Indebtedness so modified, refinanced, refunded, renewed, replaced, exchanged or extended except   by an amount equal to unpaid accrued interest and premium thereon plus other reasonable amount paid, and fees and   expenses reasonably incurred, in connection with such modification, refinancing, refunding, renewal, replacement,   exchange or extension and by an amount equal to any existing commitments unutilized thereunder and as otherwise   permitted to be incurred or issued pursuant to Section 7
